column2: MMNS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have early onset arthritis, depression, autoimmunity, plus dislocated my elbow 4 months ago.  The arthritis was so bad in my right knee that I needed a cortisone shot in it at 43 yrs old?  Had several Rx from different Drs that were making me feel totally out of control, so went to see my primary Dr to review all my meds and figure out which were best to take.  She took me off off all the codeine based meds and changed my depression meds.  Now I take 50 mg of this for pain and depression plus celexa for depression as well.  I can hardly believe how much better I feel.  There is little to no pain, I can walk comfortably.  I even noticed that the occasional lower back pain I used to have has gone away!  I was told to take this and the celexa before bed so the drowsiness hasn't been a problem.  I have noticed that I am more irritable than before.  Overall, though, I have had a positive experience with this drug.

column2: shire, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: SKNY, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am taking this medication for fybromyalgia pain, and for associated sleep problems. Over about a year, I worked up to 40mg a day (taken at night). I've now started to take 50mg a day. Early on, last year, I had dry mouth and was sleepy. Constipation has been an ongoing issue, but is easily addressed with a daily dose of fiber supplements. I think there's been some impact on my weight, but not terrible. The more serious side effect was that at the very beginning, the med made me feel more depressed, sometimes even somewhat suicidal, but I decided to stick it out for a while, and I'm glad I did, because the side-effects subsided after about a 4-6 weeks. The very big upside is that my pain was significantly diminished, and my sleep got much better (I hadn't had a decent night's sleep in 5 years without Ambien, and I do react well to sleeping meds). I still sometimes get headaches from neck pain, but my MD suggested an Ativan (Lorazepam), which I take occasionally, and which usually helps. Over time the Pamelor also had a positive effect on my feelings of depression, and my fibro-related fogginess lifted quite a bit. I have had some recent resurgence in pain, so my GP suggested  that extra 10mg a day to go up to 50mg (something my neurologist had recommended many months ago). I started in the past week, and am noticing renewed side-effects--the dry mouth (and bad taste in my mouth) is back, I'm sleeping long, long hours (12-14), and the constipation is worse.  BUT I'm hoping that, since these eventually eased before, they will again. Overall so far, I think Nortiptyline (generic Pamelor) has been a very successful treatment for me.

column2: SKNY, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am taking this medication for fybromyalgia pain, and for associated sleep problems. Over about a year, I worked up to 40mg a day (taken at night). I've now started to take 50mg a day. Early on, last year, I had dry mouth and was sleepy, but over a month or so, those eased up. Constipation has been an ongoing issue, but is easily addressed with a daily dose of fiber supplements. I think there's been some impact on my weight, but not terrible. The good news is that my pain was significantly diminished, and my sleep got much better. (I still sometimes get headaches from my neck pain, but my MD suggested an Ativan (Lorazepam), which I take occasionally, and which usually helps). The Pamelor has also had a positive effect on my feelings of depression, and my fibro-related fogginess lifted quite a bit. After some recent resurgence in pain, my GP suggested  taking that extra 10mg a day to go up to 50mg (something my neurologist had recommended months ago). I started in the past week. I am noticing renewed side-effects--the dry mouth (and bad taste in my mouth) is back, I'm sleeping long, long hours (12-14), and the constipation is worse.  BUT I'm hoping that, since these side effects eventually subsided before, they will go away again. Overall so far, I think Nortiptyline (generic Pamelor) has been a very successful treatment for me.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This medication took a couple of weeks to start working. After about 2 weeks I could tell a difference in myself. I was happier and felt less anxious. My family noticed a difference in me too (I wasn't soo gloomy and grouchy anymore.) For the most part I would say Pamelor has helped me. My only issue is that I sometimes forget to take it. I take it once daily at bedtime. If I'm really tired when going to bed, I sometimes forget to take it. I end up missing that dose because I don't want to take it the next morning (because I'm concerned that it might be too close to the next dose.) When I miss 1 or 2 doses, I end up feeling depressed, angry, and anxious all over again. This has just happened to me, so today I set an alarm in my phone to remind me to take it every night. All-in-All, As long as I keep up with it, It gives me great results!

I took Excedrin for a headache which has caffeiene and had another reaction. My heartbeat was nearly 200 and could not see straight, dizzy, talking to myself. Rode in ambulance so out of it. Hearing voices in my head, wanting to die, extremely sleepy, did nothing by lay in my bed.I am still suicidal and it has nearly been a month. I'm surprised I have made it through everything. column2: Dina, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Taking for L/2 hnp, L4-5 bulges,L5-s1 slip & deg disc & possible piriformis syndrome. Pain level in butt & legs up to an 8 of 10 at times,sitting was excruciating and I couldn't even stand the bedsheet to touch my left leg/foot. I had a level of 5-6 often.At first on this drug, had heart palpitations, crazy non-stop dreaming except to jerk awake, diarrhea, nausea, eye twitches. started at 10mg a day. Side affects x 4weeks, now none! I've been on it 8 months and it doesn't even really make me sleepy (bummer). Now taking 30mg a day two pills in pm, one in am.On pain-free days I think drug is great.  On bad days,not so great! But bad days now around level 4-5 w/lots of 0-2 days now. I keep up exercise, home physical therapy, ice, stretching, & rest & steroid shots though, it's a multi-pronged approach.I advise to titrate up really slowly,less of a shock that way. I'm trying to avoid having to take narcotics, and trying to avoid Neurontin; afraid I'll want to stab somebody with a salad fork on that stuff after reading it's reviews. (But,local pharmacist says Neurontin mostly just makes you sleepy and someday I may have no choice) Right now,this is helping some, not interfering with my life and I can still titrate up to 50mg a day if needed.Good luck to all of us nerve pain sufferers-many of us look & try to act quite normal, but spend a lot of time in misery.

column2: catdog, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It took the fog away but taken for a continual period I experienced short term memory loss...I think! seriously I did.

column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My doctor prescribed this medication to help with my migraines associated with my menstral period.  At first the medication did not work so he increased the dosage to 50mg per day.  I feel the best I have felt in years!

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drug had the following side effects: strong headaches (I am surprised some people take it for migraines), horrible nightmares, dizziness, irritability, drowsiness. The only good side effect: weight loss. I take a very low dosage (25 mg) and this has not helped at all with my depression. I feel just as miserable as when I started taking it. I am going to my psychiatrist tomorrow and request to be taken off of it.

column2: Lynn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: At the highest dosage, I've experienced an almost complete relief from arthritic pain and depression.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was prescibed Pamelor 20 years ago for depression.  Taking the drug was very difficult-- it took a good two weeks for my body to adjust to the medicine.  I remember falling over in class because I was so tired-- I couldn't keep my eyes open during the adjustment period.  Also, it caused SEVERE constipation for me.  Overall, the drug worked so-so for depression.  I was very happy when newer depression class drugs became available. In fact, I am surprised that they still prescribe this-- it is so old school.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took this medication 1988-1990.  It worked well at first but then I began eperiencing extreme depression episodes, even worse than the ones I had before I started this medication.  Also experienced side effects such as constipation and acid reflux.  Also took Lexapro and Effexor and had no such side effects.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: this drug made me very happy and gave me  the happiness and meaning to my life that i had been missing.

column2: msdlad52, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have MS and it helps me deal with the emotions and everything going on with my family.

column2: tigerlily, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I took Nortriptyline for 4 weeks to ease my fibromyalgia symptoms. It kicks the depression and anxiety in the butt, but my migraines persisted and my heart kinda went wacky. I had to go off of it. Too bad because I was becoming interested in doing things again. I am now on Doxepin which is making me irritable and sleepy.

column2: rhinerstoneroses, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have taken this for a year. When I first took it, it even everything out almost to a numbing effect. I did not experience any highs. I took 10mg then 20 mg. I felt better but it seems you need to take more and more to feel the same better. My dr is now trying zoloft with pamelor tapering off.

column2: ajz, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medice really helped with my nerve pain in my lower back. It also helped to sleep at night, but I had to quit taking it due to side effects such as dizziness,couldn't seem to function in the mornings, and tired most of the time.

column2: thirdpin, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Pamelor is for me although I was gaining weight, and the migraines remained with me at a rate of about four or so a month. For this I took another prescription drug. However after my doctor added another med, it resulted in nearly 100% reduction of migraines. I have not had a "real" migraine since I don't know when!I sometimes have drowsiness when awaking in the morning on occasions. Sometimes I go through weak periods where sitting becomes a necessity, and standing is not an option. Because I feel that I will collapse otherwise.Over all I have had great success with this med, and it seems like the weight problem stopped when I went on the second med.  I write this positive report because all of the reports I read were negative. Of course my problem may not have been as severe as those whose woes I read.I've been to the well known migraine clinic North of Chicago, to a doctor in Elkhart, IN (whom I heard had success with migraines), then to this neurologist.

column2: why me, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After two years of not knowing exactly what was causing my double vision and slurred speech I come to find out that it was migraines and was prescribed this medication. While I have not been on this medicine for a long time I have experience the grut of the side effects. I have had no appetite, feeling dizzy, feeling like I'm in a fog, feelng very irritated by everyone and everything and that is not my personality to be that way. I would not advise anyone that is or isn't depressed to take this medicine because if you didn't feel nutty before you will after:(

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I take this for Fibromyalgia, I experience better sleep and less pain, however I still experience some pain. I definetly notice a difference when I DON'T take it. Very little side effects as long as the dose stays low. Otherwise I feel very numb and lethargic.

column2: ldr3, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: does increase heart rate and weight gain, but if you watch what you eat you wont gain the weight...

column2: 123456789, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i love this pamelor oral because i feel happy and intergetic all the time.

column2: abdominal pain, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My husband is on this drug for extreme abdominal pain dr. says is ibs. he takes 3 50 mg pills a day. pain has gone

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: the neuropathy pain in my feet were so bad I didn't feel like it was worth living with! From the first night I took this I have had zero pain. The side effects however have been constipation and weight gain. I had gain alot of weight due to my foot pain and no I have been gaining more. I hope to find an anwser for the weight, but I can not go back to that horriffic pain. It has been a God sent!!!

column2: luvtobemum, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have chronic daily tension headaches and this medicine has helped me. But its been a few years now and its not working as good now. I may have to try another one. My headaches are getting bad again.. :( I take 2 (10mg) tablets at night.

column2: Rel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My Physician has prescribed to me several different types of SSRI's with no success, I have been taking this drug for 1 week and I am not happy! I have extreme dry mouth to the point to where I am choking and throwing up! I have tried to suck on sugar free candy, cough drops, plenty of fluids and no releif...it's torture and I can't take it! 25mg

column2: Kim, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: What's worse migraines with fibro and arthritis, or cotton mouth, constantly dizzy, stuck in a fog, and gaining 20+ pounds?  I'm sorry it's almost worth dealing with the horrible natural pain than the horrible misery these pills put you in.

column2: krhgeh, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking the medication for migraines.  I am sleeping at night which I don't do.  I don't feel groggy in the mornings but I do have the dry mouth, swelling hands, weight gain and increased appetite.  I don't like the side effects at all.  I am going to talk to my doctor for a second choice.

column2: labu1964, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: If this medication is to help pain than they need to make sure that it does work on pain. I feel this medication is not for that and that doctors should prescribe it for the reasons it was made for.

column2: 7725 state rt 812, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
T from Lou. KY, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I don't really know what is worse, the occasional migraine or the side effects from this stuff. Dry mouth, weight gain, drowsiness and yet sleepless. I think I'd prefer another option

column2: aka, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Lots and lots of bad side-efects, inc.;hand swelling, lethargy, increased appetite & weight gain. I had to discontinue use even though it was releiving chronic pain.

column2: LBear1947, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It works great and I've taken all the anti-deprressants. I also ave migraines. I ave basically no side affects besides dry mouth but they all do that.

column2: Sally, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: A Rhuematologist precribed this medication for fibromyalgia and migraines.It takes a while to get meds adjusted,but am 80% better than before.I actually did yard work yesterday!I have only taken 4 Lortabs in 5 weeks!!I can live with side affects better than with pain.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Left me feeling groggy and tired. Unable to concentrate during the day.

column2: Janie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more
column9: This is the best medication for depression. I have tried a lot of others and this is the only one that does it all for me. I have been on it since 1980.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: If you have problems with headaches, take the medication that is used to treat them.  Do not take an antidepressant for this condition even if there is a chance it would calm them.

column2: rab, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: it  is  good  it took  off  pocet

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Have to take maximum dose. Weight gain, approx 20#

column2: jthelen, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I work nights and this medication is supposed to be taken at the same time every day which is very difficult. Plus it made me very tired I would sleep for 10-15 hours a day (wow)! I was constantly confused like i was wondering aroud in fog. Plus the doctor started me on 1 pill for 3 days, then 2 pills for 3 days,  then 3 pills for the remainder of the month!

column2: d,  Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I'm using Pamelor/nortryptyline for sleep. I have fibro and don't use it as an antidepressant. I haven't had a "hung over" feeling in the morning.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have fibromyalgia withh migraines. I take this medication for the migraines but since i've taken it i've been sleeping through the night, don't have muscle pain and haven't had a migraine at all. I do feel groggy during the day but I can live with it better than the pain.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I doctor put me on this medication to prevent migranes, dut to the fact that I do not sleep threw the night. The sleep aid helps me sleep well and I haven't had a migrane while on it. I do fill groggy more often during the day though and have headaches when i miss a dose.

column2: ladylike, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been waiting for a diognosis concerning my side of head and neck pain(and neurological symptoms) for 18months now,suggestive of vasculitis,arteritis,M.S.After a year on this drug i tried 2weeks without it as i ran out.My seriouse head pain retuned.Since ive been taking it again the pain has reduced and i dont need to take other pain relief so often.
